channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Some progress made in recovering U.S. Army soldiers submerged in Lithuanian swamp
item.description: U.S. Navy divers managed to successfully attach a line to a hoist point on the submerged vehicle. The goal is to hook up more hoists in order to pull the vehicle carrying the soldiers out of the mud.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Navy divers managed to successfully attach a line to a hoist point on the submerged vehicle. The goal is to hook up more hoists in order to pull the vehicle carrying the soldiers out of the mud.

(Image credit: Petras Malukas)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Trump is 'not joking' about third term, though Constitution says he can't serve
item.description: In remarks to NBC News, Trump also said "there are methods which you could do it." Trump would need either a two-thirds vote in Congress or a constitutional convention to serve a third term.
item.content:encoded:
In remarks to NBC News, Trump also said "there are methods which you could do it." Trump would need either a two-thirds vote in Congress or a constitutional convention to serve a third term.

(Image credit: Manuel Balce Ceneta/AP)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: U.S. Institute of Peace staff is laid off, escalating legal battle with Trump administration
item.description: The think tank is laying off nearly all of its staff, as its former board sues to stop what it calls a "takeover" by the Trump administration.
item.content:encoded:
The think tank is laying off nearly all of its staff, as its former board sues to stop what it calls a "takeover" by the Trump administration.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Nine home runs for the Yankees lead to questions about their new bats
item.description: Some Yankees players used a new bat during the second game in the Major League Baseball series against the Milwaukee Brewers.
item.content:encoded:
Some Yankees players used a new bat during the second game in the Major League Baseball series against the Milwaukee Brewers. 

(Image credit: Angelina Katsanis)
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana

item.title: Iran has rejected direct negotiations with the US in response to Trump's letter
item.description: Iran's president said the Islamic Republic rejected direct negotiations with the United States over its rapidly advancing nuclear program, Tehran's first response to a letter sent by President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Iran's president said the Islamic Republic rejected direct negotiations with the United States over its rapidly advancing nuclear program, Tehran's first response to a letter sent by President Trump.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Richard Chamberlain, TV actor who starred in 'Dr. Kildare,' dies at 90
item.description: Richard Chamberlain, the handsome hero of the 1960s television series "Dr. Kildare" who found a second career as an award-winning "king of the miniseries," has died. He was 90.
item.content:encoded:
Richard Chamberlain, the handsome hero of the 1960s television series "Dr. Kildare" who found a second career as an award-winning "king of the miniseries," has died. He was 90.

(Image credit: JAN BAUER)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: This may be the most lead polluted place on Earth. Is there any hope?
item.description: The U.N. has identified Kabwe, a city of almost 300,000 people in Zambia, as one of the most polluted places on the planet. Who is to blame? And can justice be done?
item.content:encoded:
The U.N. has identified Kabwe, a city of almost 300,000 people in Zambia, as one of the most polluted places on the planet. Who is to blame? And can justice be done?

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Julie Bourdin

item.title: Medical supplies in great need as aid flows into Myanmar after earthquake
item.description: Emergency aid has streamed into Southeast Asia in the two days since a massive earthquake struck Myanmar and Thailand.
item.content:encoded:
Emergency aid has streamed into Southeast Asia in the two days since a massive earthquake struck Myanmar and Thailand.

(Image credit: Haymhan Aung/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: As measles cases rise, some parents become vaccine enthusiasts
item.description: Vaccine hesitancy has been growing in the U.S. in recent years. But as Texas measles cases rise and other states report outbreaks too, some parents want their kids to get their shots early.
item.content:encoded:
Vaccine hesitancy has been growing in the U.S. in recent years. But as Texas measles cases rise and other states report outbreaks too, some parents want their kids to get their shots early.

(Image credit: Karl Tapales)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Trump won't rule out military force to take Greenland
item.description: In an interview with NBC News, Trump refused to rule out military force to acquire Greenland. His remarks come a day after Vice President JD Vance's scaled back visit to the island.
item.content:encoded:
In an interview with NBC News, Trump refused to rule out military force to acquire Greenland. His remarks come a day after Vice President JD Vance's scaled back visit to the island.

(Image credit: Jim Watson/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
